name: Fluency
description: How coherent and natural the summary sounds
instruction:
1. Read and understand the evaluation criteria for the Fluency metric
2. Assess the coherence of the summary
3. Evaluate how natural the summary sounds
4. Assign a score from 1 to 5 based on the assessment

name: Relevance
description: How well the summary captures the main points of the article
instruction:
1. Read the news article carefully to understand its main points
2. Read the contestant's summary to determine its content
3. Compare the summary with the article to identify captured main points
4. Assess the summary's relevance based on the captured main points
5. Assign a score from 1 to 5 based on the relevance assessment

name: Accuracy
description: How accurate the summary is in terms of facts and figures
instruction:
1. Read and understand the evaluation criteria for the Accuracy metric
2. Assess the summary for factual accuracy
3. Check the summary for correct figures and data
4. Compare the summary with the original news article to ensure consistency
5. Assign a score from 1 to 5 based on the summary's accuracy

name: Completeness
description: How well the summary covers all the important aspects of the article
instruction:
1. Read and understand the evaluation criteria for the Completeness metric
2. Review the news article to identify all the important aspects
3. Read the contestant's summary and identify the important aspects it covers
4. Compare the summary to the article to determine how well it covers all the important aspects
5. Assign a score from 1-5 based on how well the summary covers all the important aspects of the article

name: Readability
description: How easy the summary is to read and understand
instruction:
1. Read and understand the task instructions carefully
2. Review the evaluation criteria for the Readability metric
3. Assess the clarity and coherence of the summary
4. Evaluate the overall ease of understanding the summary
5. Assign a score from 1 to 5 based on the Readability metric
